Description: Fragment of a small East Greek black-figured pottery closed vase. A lion striding to right, all but his rear legs preserved; unincised blobs as fill; added red on neck and at ribs of lion; red band between black bands above.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 11, no. 31 pl. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.916)
